entry.title: CWTK - Robert's Meat Sauce & Spagetti - Swedish Pasta

media:group.media:title: CWTK - Robert's Meat Sauce & Spagetti - Swedish Pasta
media:group.media:description:
Yes some people make meatsauce and pasta like this in Sweden and it's unironically the best and fastest way to fill your belly up with good sauce.
800gram minced Beef 2x 2dl Crème fraîche bland or whatever flavor you like 2x Onions or whatever the amount you want As much Garlic as you want, 5-6 cloves perhaps? Some concentrated tomato mush. Soysauce 2.5dl of cream "didnt use all" Spyeses. Don't forget ketchup. and a Glass of Mjölk yum

entry.title: CWTK - Love Yums / Kärleksmums - Chocolate Cake

media:group.media:title: CWTK - Love Yums / Kärleksmums - Chocolate Cake
media:group.media:description:
Welcome back to more CWTK, got a cocolate craving? Look no further, this is so easy a niendertal can make it.
Preheat Oven to 175c Start melting butter, keep a eye on it. Whip Eggs and Sugar somewhat Fluffy Add all dry ingridients and whip it some more. Take butter off stove and use it to butter a pan. Add Milk to the Butter to cool it down. Add Milk/Butter to the rest of the ingredients and whip some more. Pour into a pan and into the oven for 20-25minutes. Poke it with a toothpick to check doneness.
While the cake is in the Oven, make glaze. Melt more butter and just mash everything together to your liking.
Take out the cake and pour the glaze evenly over it and add coco or whatever the hell you want.
Done
Cake: 225g Butterr 2dl Milk 5x Egg 4,5dl Sugar 3 teaspoons Baking powder 6dl Floor 1 overfilled tablespoon Vanilla Suger 1,5dl Cocoa Powder 3 teaspoons of baking soda.
Glaze: 100g Butter Coffee of some sort or Instant Coffee. 1dl Cacao almost 2 tablespoons Vanila suger LOTS OF FLOOR SUGAR or about 4-5DL Coconut Flakes
Explosion Effect by Green Screen Fisher. https://youtu.be/7tLoIq1Vmig
Music Off to Osaka / Overcast - Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/
